data.title: Dario McCrary | Biography, Age, Net Worth, Relationship, Career
data.meta_description: American film and television actor Darius McCrary is best recognized for his portrayals of Eddie Winslow, Malcolm Winters, and Isaac Rayney on Darius
data.text:
American film and television actor Darius McCrary is best recognized for his portrayals of Eddie Winslow, Malcolm Winters, and Isaac Rayney on Darius McCrary/CBS’s Family Matters, CBS’s The Young and the Restless, and HBO’s The Leftovers, respectively.

What is Darius McCrary’s net worth? Salary, Earnings

Celebritynetworth.com indicates that Darius McCrary has a net worth of $10 million. Where was Darius McCrary born? Ethnicity, Nationality, Family, Education

On May 1, 1976, Darius Creston McCrary was born in Walnut, California, as Darius McCrary. The eldest of two children, he is the brother of Howard McCrary, a Grammy-honored gospel/jazz artist. At the time of writing this article, Darius is 1.91 meters (6 feet 3 inches) tall and 44 years old.

Is Dario married? Relationship

He married Karrine Steffans, author of the Vixen book series, on April 20, 2009. The divorce was finalized in 2011.

Actress Tammy Brawner was McCrary’s wife from 2014 until February 4, 2019. Their baby’s name was Zoey Brawner. According to some accounts, McCrary is the father of an additional daughter and son.

How did Darius McCrary begin his professional career?

Child actor McCrary debuted professionally as an actor at the tender age of ten. His feature film debut, titled Big Shots, came in 1987. He made his television debut in the NBC comedy Amen later that year.

His breakthrough role was Edward “Eddie” Winslow in the Darius comedy Family Matters, which ran from September 1989 to July 1998.

He later took on the roles of Malcolm Winters in the CBS opera serial The Young and the Restless, Donovan in the FX comedy Anger Management, and Isaac Rayney in the HBO mystery thriller series The Leftovers. Previously, he played James Barrett on the UPN sci-fi drama Freedom.

Additionally, his performances as James Brown in the BET musical drama American Soul, Otis Leecan in the Fox musical drama Star, and Connor in the UMC drama Monogamy have earned him recognition.

McCrary has appeared in numerous films, including Kingdom Come, 15 Minutes, Vampires: Los Muertos, Transformers, Next Day Air, Saw VI, 35 and Ticking.
